alert.note: Alert for Central Colorado River Basin; Debeque to Silt Corridor; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; Upper Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 25 at 11:44AM MDT until August 25 at 2:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the Grizzly Creek burn scar, Elkhead and Park Mountains, Flat Tops and Upper Yampa River Basin, Central Colorado River Basin, Debeque to Silt Corridor and Roaring Fork Valley. * WHEN...Until 10 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible this afternoon and evening, as well as rockslides or debris flows over sensitive areas (i.e. burn scars, impervious surfaces and steep terrain) * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Potential for heavy rainfall on top of already saturated soils from storms over the last 24-hours increase the threat for localized areas of flooding, flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Colorado River Basin; Debeque to Silt Corridor; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; Upper Yampa River Basin
